title: How to Plan and Host a BBQ

steps.headline: Choose the right day.
steps.description: Barbecues are best hosted outdoors under the sunny weather. Avoid picking a day that is raining, cold or windy. You want the perfect summer weather when you have a barbecue with friends/family!

steps.headline: Plan your guest list.
steps.description: Consider whether you want friends over or family (or maybe both). Remember not to invite too many people because you'll have to cater for them all.

steps.headline: Plan where you'll have the BBQ.
steps.description: Usually one is held on the garden/patio/porch. Make sure there are places for people to sit such as benches and rugs. Decorate the area with lanterns for a magical evening BBQ or just a nice rustic venue. Some parks or venues offer free barbecues to heat up and use on their lot. Consider having a barbecue out in a public park for something different.

steps.headline: Plan the food and drink.
steps.description: Think of your guests. Are they children? Vegetarians? Make sure there is something for everyone. Burgers, sausages, ribs and kebabs are popular. Make sure there are some side dishes like potato salad, salad, couscous, watermelon, etc. Have drinks such as lemonade, beer, smoothies or even just water! You want most foods that are able to go on a grill since you'll be barbecuing them. Salads just be made before-hand to give yourself more time ahead.

steps.headline: Plan some games/activities.
steps.description: Go and plan fun games you used to play as a kid! Maybe a game of rounders! Remind your guests to wear suitable footwear. Remember to choose suitable games for children if you have families attending. Perhaps even setting up an above-ground pool will be satisfactory.

steps.headline: Have someone to look after the BBQ.
steps.description:
Make sure that someone or even yourself is at the BBQ at all times when food is cooking on it! On the day of the BBQ, prepare all your side dishes in advance, either the morning before the BBQ or the night before.
